H0.text: The gastroâ€‘esophageal sphincter is located at the stomach end of the esophagus and opens to allow the bolus to enter the stomach.

H1.text: The pupillary sphincter is located at the stomach end of the esophagus and opens to allow the bolus to enter the stomach.

H2.text: The pyloric sphincter is located at the stomach end of the esophagus and opens to allow the bolus to enter the stomach.

H3.text: Urethral sphincter is the sphincter located at the stomach end of the esophagus and opens to allow the bolus to enter the stomach.

A4.text: The lower esophageal sphincter, or gastroesophageal sphincter, surrounds the lower part of the esophagus at the gastroesophageal junction between the esophagus and the stomach.
